TV Sitcoms & Comedy Shows.name: Golden Age Giggles
TV Sitcoms & Comedy Shows.description: Test your knowledge of classic sitcoms and iconic comedy shows from television's golden age. From 'Happy Days' spin-offs to network abbreviations, this quiz covers a wide range of familiar faces and moments. Are you a true fan of these timeless shows?

questions.text: Which of these television programs did not feature characters introduced on 'Happy Days'?
questions.hint: This show about cousins in Chicago has no connection to the ‘Happy Days’ universe.

questions.text: In what city is TV's 'The Mary Tyler Moore Show' set?
questions.hint: This city is a major hub in the Midwest, known for its cold winters.

questions.text: In the television network abbreviation 'ABC' what does the 'A' stand for?
questions.hint: The name reflects the network’s national scope in the United States.

questions.text: What is Delta Burke's character's job on the sitcom 'Designing Women'?
questions.hint: Her character works on creating stylish home environments.

TV Sitcoms & Comedy Shows.name: Seinfeld & Beyond
TV Sitcoms & Comedy Shows.description: Dive into the quirky world of 'Seinfeld' and other beloved sitcoms. This quiz explores memorable moments and characters from shows that defined a generation of comedy. Can you recall the details of these hilarious television experiences?

questions.text: On TV's 'Seinfeld' what type of doctor did Mr. Costanza go to when he sat on 'fusilli Jerry'?
questions.hint: The incident involved a delicate area, requiring a specialist in that region.

questions.text: Which of the boys on the TV show 'My Three Sons' is adopted?
questions.hint: This boy’s name starts with ‘E’ and he joined the family later in the series.

questions.text: What character did Woody replace on the TV show 'Cheers'?
questions.hint: This character was an older bartender who passed away before Woody joined.

questions.hint: This character was an older bartender who passed away before Woody joined.
